definitions.definition: to happen or exist one after the other repeatedly:
examples: She alternated between cheerfulness and deep despair.

definitions.definition: to make something happen or exist one after the other repeatedly:
examples: He alternated working in the office with long tours overseas.

definitions.definition: with first one thing, then another thing, and then the first thing again:
examples: a dessert with alternate layers of chocolate and cream

definitions.definition: If something happens on alternate days, it happens every second day:
examples: Private cars are banned from the city on alternate days.

definitions.definition: An alternate plan or method is one that you can use if you do not want to use another one.
a person or thing that can take the place of another:
examples: David was too sick to attend, so Janet served as his alternate.
